docs.lead_paragraph: JOHN PIELMEIER'S philosophical drama, ''Agnes of God,'' was a long-running hit on Broadway. Now that this play about a young nun accused of murdering her baby has closed in New York, other theaters have been able to acquire the production rights, which is why a plethora of ''Agnes of Gods'' have recently appeared. The most recent production is at the Studio Theater in Lindenhurst, through Jan. 6, and it is almost flawless in its execution. The director, Roy F. Siegel, has shaped the Pielmeier drama so that the weaknesses inherent in the script are smoothed over and the play's strengths are as fully realized as in the original Broadway production.
